intro: Rhodiola kunlunica, commonly known as the Kunlun rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pink or red flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, cold environments and possesses a robust root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Rhodiola kunlunica is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, including antioxidant and adaptogenic effects. Its unique ecological niche makes it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
